user_query: new shoes... And even treats him to a bowl of jjajangmyeon. "2,300 won, please." Looking back and forth between Grandma and the money, Sang-woo passes by a store that sells batteries... but keeps walking. Batteries Grandma checks inside the bus to see if she recognizes anyone. "Is this not the right one?" The truth is—Grandma can't read. "Yes, this is the one. Go ahead and get on." "Someone asked me how you're doing. You should go see them sometime." Grandma plans to visit her old friend who runs a small shop. Meanwhile, Sang-woo is a little distracted by a local girl. "She keeps asking what I want to eat..." "Choco Pie." Grandma picks up a Choco Pie wrapper and heads to her friend's place. "You're here?" "Your knees? Same as always." "So your grandson's come, huh?" "Choco Pie?" "Two of them?" "Here, take one more. Of course." "Leave it." "Hey, leave the veggies too." "Oh no, please. We'll enjoy them." "My knees hurt too much to go out." "Let's meet again before I die." "It's called 'Rabid Rabbit' or something." Sang-woo takes the Choco Pies from Grandma and heads to the back of the bus. "Don't worry, Grandma. I'll make sure we get off together." But Grandma doesn't get on. She asks Sang-woo to take their things. "Isn't Sang-woo's grandma getting on?" "She said she'll finish her errands and come later. Told us to go ahead." "Wow, you really understand your grandma well." Sang-woo arrives first and waits for her to return. "This one's for tomorrow." Sang-woo returns home,

entities.entity_description: 상우는 할머니와 함께 시골에 온 손자로, 할머니의 심부름을 도우며 버스를 타고 먼저 집에 돌아오는 인물이다
할머니는 상우의 할머니로, 글을 읽지 못하며 무릎이 아픈 노인이다. 오래된 친구를 방문하고 손자를 돌본다
할머니의 오랜 친구로 작은 가게를 운영하며, 무릎이 아파 외출이 어려운 인물이다
상우의 관심을 끄는 동네 소녀로, 상우에게 뭘 먹고 싶냐고 계속 물어보는 인물이다

relationships.relationship_description: 상우는 할머니의 손자이며 함께 시골에서 지내고 있다
할머니는 오랜 친구를 방문하여 초코파이와 채소를 나눈다
상우는 동네 소녀에게 관심을 보이며 약간 정신이 팔려있다
